workspace.name: nWind
workspace.query: (: : This Workspace contains reports and examples about an Entity Services scenario, : using Northwind data. It's designed with simplicity in mind, not real business data. : Once you have deployed code artefacts (either './gradlew -PexampleDir=e2e-nwind mldeploy' or './gradlew mldeploy' from e2e directory.) : and run the e2e Loader ('./gradlew rune2eNwind') you can step : through these tabs to see what happened. :)

(: Using database entity-services-e2e-content :) import module namespace es = "http://marklogic.com/entity-services" at "/MarkLogic/entity-services/entity-services.xqy";
( "Raw docs (2258 expected): ", count(cts:search(collection("raw"), cts:true-query())), "Non raw (3167 expected): ", count(cts:search(collection(), cts:not-query(cts:collection-query("raw")))), "Superstore envelopes (1261 expected): ", count(cts:search(collection("superstore-envelopes"), cts:true-query())), "Order envelopes (829 expected): ", count(cts:search(collection("order-envelopes"), cts:true-query())), "Order version 2 envelopes (829 expected): ", count(cts:search(collection("Order-0.0.2-envelopes"), cts:true-query())), "Customer envelopes (91 expected): ", count(cts:search(collection("customer-envelopes"), cts:true-query())), "Product envelopes (77 expected): ", count(cts:search(collection("product-envelopes"), cts:true-query())), "Product version 2 envelopes (77 expected): ", count(cts:search(collection("Product-0.0.2-envelopes"), cts:true-query())), "Collection names", cts:collections() )

/* * Using database entity-services-e2e-content * Making sure that none of the tables have null entry * Northwind1 is the schema name for version1 * Northwind2 is the schema name for version2 * */
-- select * from Northwind1.'order'; -- 829 rows select * from Northwind1.customer order by CustomerID; -- 91 rows -- select * from Northwind2.product; -- 81 rows -- select * from order_orderdetails order by orderid;-- 2152 rows -- select * from superstore -- 1261 rows

-- USE entity-services-e2e-content; -- Query to list all product details per order id
SELECT Northwind1.'Order'.OrderID, Northwind1.'Order'.CustomerID, Northwind1.'Order'.OrderDate, Northwind1.Product.ProductID, Northwind1.Product.ProductName, Northwind1.Product.UnitPrice, Northwind1.Product.SupplierID FROM Northwind1.'Order' JOIN Northwind1.Order_OrderDetails AS o ON Northwind1.'Order'.OrderID = o.OrderID JOIN Northwind1.Product ON o.ProductID = Northwind1.Product.ProductID Order By Northwind1.'Order'.OrderID

-- USE entity-services-e2e-content; -- Query to list all customers and their details who purchased a particular product /* Query for Order Total by country SELECT c.Country as Country, COUNT(o.OrderID) as Order_Total_By_Country FROM 'Order' o, 'Customer' c where c.CustomerId = o.CustomerID group by c.Country */
SELECT Northwind1.'Order'.OrderID, Northwind1.Customer.CustomerID, Northwind1.Customer.CompanyName, Northwind1.Customer.Country, Northwind1.Customer.ContactTitle FROM Northwind1.'Order' JOIN Northwind1.Customer ON 'Order'.CustomerID = Northwind1.Customer.CustomerID JOIN Northwind1.Order_OrderDetails As o ON Northwind1.'Order'.orderid=o.OrderID where productid=1 Order By Northwind1.'Order'.orderid

(: Test to bind envelopes to doc uri :)
sem:sparql(' prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> prefix foaf: <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/> prefix fn: <http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions#>
select ?s ?docUri ?xml where { ?s a foaf:Person ; rdfs:isDefinedBy ?docUri . BIND (fn:doc($docUri) as $xml) } LIMIT 2 ', (), (), sem:ruleset-store("subClassOf.rules", sem:store()))

(: Range index test for DB properties generated :) xquery version "1.0-ml"; import module namespace es = "http://marklogic.com/entity-services" at "/MarkLogic/entity-services/entity-services.xqy";
(: should return product id 1 from both ver1 and ver2 :) cts:search(doc(), cts:path-range-query("//es:instance/Product/ProductID","<",2)), (: should return 1 result since customer only has ver1 envelope :) cts:search(doc(), cts:path-range-query("//es:instance/Customer/CustomerID","=","VINET","collation=http://marklogic.com/collation/en")), (: should return 1 macthed result from superstore dataset :) cts:search(doc(), cts:path-range-query("//es:instance/Superstore/ProductName","=","Xerox 1981","collation=http://marklogic.com/collation/en"))
